related_content.title: Shiokawa, K., Y. Kato, Y. Hamaguchi, Y. Yamamoto, T. Adachi, M. Ozaki, S.-I. Oyama, M. Nosé, et al. (2017), Ground-based instruments of the PWING project to investigate dynamics of the inner magnetosphere at subauroral latitudes as a part of the ERG-ground coordinated observation network, Earth Planets Space, 69:160.

rights_list.rights: Acknowledgements for ISEE OMTI imager data

description_list.description: All-sky imager data taken by an optical mesosphere thermosphere imager (OMTI) with various filters at Abuja, Nigeria, in order to investigate the dynamics of the upper atmosphere through nocturnal airglow emissions. The image data consist of OI (557.7 nm), OI (630.0 nm), OH-bands, OI (777.4 nm), and background (572.5 nm) emissions.

fund.funder_name: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science (JSPS)

rights_list.rights: Acknowledgements for ISEE OMTI imager data

description_list.description: All-sky imager data taken by an optical mesosphere thermosphere imager (OMTI) with various filters at Kapuskasing, Canada, in order to investigate the dynamics of the upper atmosphere through nocturnal airglow emissions. The image data consist of OI (557.7 nm), OI (630.0 nm), Hbeta (486.1 nm), OH-bands, and background (572.5 nm) emissions.

fund.funder_name: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science (JSPS)

rights_list.rights: Acknowledgements for ISEE OMTI imager data

description_list.description: All-sky imager data taken by an optical mesosphere thermosphere imager (OMTI) with various filters at Kototabang, Indonesia, in order to investigate the dynamics of the upper atmosphere through nocturnal airglow emissions. The image data consist of OI (557.7 nm), OI (630.0 nm), OI (777.4 nm), OH-bands, and background (572.5 nm) emissions. The operation period of camera #5 is from October 26, 2002 to June 10, 2010.

rights_list.rights: Acknowledgements for ISEE OMTI imager data

description_list.description: All-sky imager data taken by an optical mesosphere thermosphere imager (OMTI) (Camera #3) with various filters at Sata, Japan, in order to investigate the dynamics of the upper atmosphere through nocturnal airglow emissions. The image data consist of OI (557.7 nm), OI (630.0 nm), OH-bands, and background (572.5 nm) emissions. The operation period of Camera #3 is from Octber 28, 2009 to April 8, 2021.

fund.funder_name: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science (JSPS)
